title: Secdir review by Alan DeKok
body:
Some simple clarifications about PMTUD primarily.  And more citations overall.

The and/any nit fix is in #16.

The MUST here was clear about not including a value >MAX, but the server cannot
enforce that sensibly.

title: Relationship with other constraints on implementations
body:
Add an applicability statement.  This only addresses buffer space issues, not
processing or bandwidth constraints.  I didn't observe (in the introduction)
that this can negatively affect bandwidth, that's later.

Hannes also observed that we don't really talk about the path MTU.  I made it
clear that these are separate and independent limitations.

For @hannestschofenig

title: Define how to measure for TLS 1.2 (and earlier)
body:
This isn't as easy as in TLS 1.3, which has a clearly defined structure for what is fed into the AEAD.  I've done my best.

@hannestschofenig, this is the only change from your email that you might disagree with.  Can you have a look please?

repo.name: tls-record-limit
repo.description: Limit the size of TLS records

title: Limit expansion when size is reduced
body:
The idea of this change is to try to constrain how much padding
a sender can add.  This is done by calculating the size of a
record with maximum plaintext and minimum padding.  No other record
can exceed this size, though smaller packets can pad to reach this
size.

I was going to include a formula, then realized that the simple
answer is best: pad to the record size limit, then pad to get
to a multiple of the block size as normal.  Most implementations
will be OK because they don't bother with the first step.
